reasoning: [Specific Program Not Verified] Paper mentions 'Bantuan Langsung Tunai (BLT)' but search could not confirm this as graduation program: Perplexity search result: Bantuan Langsung Tunai (BLT) is a social protection program in Indonesia that provides direct cash transfers to low-income families, specifically targeting the bottom income deciles of the population. The 2025 BLT Kesra iteration, as well as historical BLT programs, distributes unconditional cash assistance to millions of households for consumption support purposes[1][2][3][6][8]. There is no evidence from official communications, program descriptions, or independent evaluations that BLT includes components for productive asset transfers or multi-component livelihood support (such as skills training, savings, or business assets) typical of graduation programs. While there is a separate government internship program launched in parallel with BLT Kesra, the BLT program itself does not contain elements characteristic of graduation models such as BRAC's, and is not structured as a multi-component approach.[1][2][3][4][6][8] | Graduation: NO, Cash: YES, Assets: NO | Confidence: HIGH | Sources: https://www.setneg.go.id/baca/index/mensesneg_blt_tambahan_dari_efisiensi_anggaran, https://www.ekon.go.id/publikasi/detail/6607/pemerintah-resmi-luncurkan-program-blt-kesejahteraan-rakyat-dan-program-magang-lulusan-perguruan-tinggi, https://setkab.go.id/pemerintah-luncurkan-bantuan-langsung-tunai-kesejahteraan-rakyat-untuk-35-juta-keluarga/
